p: The CA_EO was the most effective against S. aureus, E. coli, C. albicans and H. pylori with inhibition zones of 25, 8, and 15 mm ( Figure 1) respectively. Additionally, the CA_EO showed a complete inhibition at the same concentration against H. pylori and showed antimicrobial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. At the same concentration antimicrobial activity against E. coli was slightly lower than that against S. aureus and C. albicans ( p < 0.05). The MICs of the CA_EO against the bacteria mentioned above were 19.0, 36.0, 31.0, and 30.0 μg/mL respectively ( Table 3). The MIC for LS_EO against the above-mentioned bacteria was 64.0 μg/mL. The chemical composition of CA_EO which is primarily composed of α-terpineol (27.96%), eucalyptol (21.63%), and β-phellandrene (14.84%). On the other hand, LS_EO which is composed by limonene (5.3%), showed strong antimicrobial activity against S. aureus and H. pylori.
